content: in this legal case an individual referred to as k filed a petition on behalf of their minor children to dispose of their inheritance money the court accepted the application and appointed a representative for the children the court sought the opinion of the lasnamäe district government who agreed to put part of the money into the childrens savings account and use the rest for their maintenance the court determined that the parent needs court consent to handle transactions on behalf of the children and must consider their best interests the court cited relevant sections of the family law act the text also discusses the process of transferring inherited shares from a deceased persons pension account to their heir the heir has the right to transfer or withdraw the shares under certain conditions if the heir has limited legal capacity their representative must obtain court consent the court must consider the childs best interests when making decisions about the transfer the guardian of the childs property must primarily use the benefits for the childs obligations and management of the property the court must also consider the childs best interests when making decisions about their rights and guardianship the guardian must deposit the childs money in a separate credit institution in this specific case the court agrees to transfer the inherited assets to the petitioners account as it is in the best interests of the child the court authorizes a deposit of eur 10000 per child in a savings account for future use and the rest of the money will be deposited in the childrens bank accounts for their support the petitioner must use the funds in the best interests of the child particularly for maintenance and education the court considers the estate and other relevant materials in making these decisions the text also mentions a legal case involving the division of property in an estate according to the law succession act the entire estate must be divided among the heirs in this case one of the heirs wants to sell a car that needs repairs and put the money into a bank account for their children the court will consider whether it is reasonable to divide the car among the coowners and if approved the transaction will be enforceable the court order is final and cannot be appealed the costs of the legal proceedings will be awarded to the petitioner and paid by the state
